title: Citi Supports Global Money Week and Financial Literacy Day in Nigeria
summary: Calabar - In honor of this year's Global Money Week and Financial Literacy Day, Citibank Nigeria Limited reinforced its commitment towards youth empowerment and development through a fully interactive day's session on financial literacy with the students of Army Day Secondary School, Ikot Ansa, Calabar. The event took place March 13, 2014 and was organized in partnership with Junior Achievement Nigeria (JAN), a financial education non-governmental organization. The program focused on educating Nigeria's youth about their economic environment while impressing upon them the importance of saving, entrepreneurship and financial value creation.
tag-1: Citi Supports Global Money Week and Financial Literacy Day in Nigeria
tag-2: Calabar – In honor of this year's Global Money Week and Financial Literacy Day, Citibank Nigeria Limited reinforced its commitment towards youth empowerment and development through a fully interactive day's session on financial literacy with the students of Army Day Secondary School, Ikot Ansa, Calabar. The event took place March 13, 2014 and was organized in partnership with Junior Achievement Nigeria (JAN), a financial education non-governmental organization. The program focused on educating Nigeria's youth about their economic environment while impressing upon them the importance of saving, entrepreneurship and financial value creation.
tag-3: Citi Country Officer for Nigeria, Mr. Omar Hafeez, was present at the occasion to deliver the lecture. While addressing students, Mr. Hafeez stressed the need for youth to be financially aware and empowered to make monetary decisions. He further encouraged students of Army Day Secondary School to prioritize their needs over their wants in order to cultivate the habit of saving.
tag-4: Also present at the occasion was the Principal of Army Day Secondary School, Mrs. Tina Efiok, the Vice Principal of Army Day Secondary School, Mrs. Bassey Ewa, a senior teacher of Army Day Secondary School (and a JAN Volunteer) Mrs. Priscilla Clearence Uket, a Programs Manager for Junior Achievement Nigeria, Mrs. Rita David-Odion and Vice President, Global Subsidiaries Group, Citibank Nigeria Limited, Mrs. Theresa Evuleocha.
tag-5: Global Money week is a yearly celebration which is commemorated across the world in honour of empowering the youth to be involved in reshaping their finances and their futures. In line with this, the Financial Literacy and Public Enlightenment Sub-Committee of the Central Bank of Nigeria's Bankers Committee launched Financial Literacy Day on March 13, 2014. Financial Literacy day serves as a time to focus on Nigeria's youth in primary and secondary schools nationwide, equipping them through the enhancement of their financial knowledge and planning skills.
